meanings.definition: The act of restoring something to its natural state.
meanings.sent1: The renaturations of the park brought back the native plants and animals.
meanings.sent2: The renaturations of the riverbank involved removing concrete and planting trees.
meanings.sent3: The renaturations of the city park made the squirrels very happy.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was a renaturations of colors, blending nature into the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The renaturations of the forest were like a magical transformation back to its original beauty.

meanings.definition: The process of returning a man-made environment to its original natural condition.
meanings.sent1: The renaturations of the industrial site included removing pollutants and planting grass.
meanings.sent2: Renaturations of the golf course involved converting it back into a natural wetland.
meanings.sent3: The renaturations of the playground turned it into a jungle gym for the animals.
meanings.sent4: The renaturations of the city skyline were like watching nature reclaim its territory.
meanings.sent5: The renaturations of the desert were a sight to behold, with greenery replacing sand dunes.
